title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs cleared of most serious charges, to remain jailed for now
byline: Sean “Diddy” Combs’ will remain behind bars for now, a judge ruled on Wednesday, after the music mogul was cleared of sex trafficking and racketeering charges that could have put him behind bars for life but found guilty of lesser prostitution-related offenses.

title: Unidentified bodies discovered in Mannar, Bagawantalawa, and Mount Lavinia
byline: Sri Lanka Police reported that three unidentified male bodies were discovered in separate locations across the country on Wednesday (July 2).

title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy, Galle and Matara districts, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Ugandan military helicopter catches fire in deadly Somalia crash
byline: A Ugandan military helicopter crashed and caught fire at the main international airport in Somalia’s capital, Mogadishu, killing five people on board.

title: Four dead, 38 missing after ferry sinks near Bali, agency says
byline: Four people died, 38 were missing and 23 survived after a ferry carrying 65 people sank near the Indonesian island of Bali, the country’s Search and Rescue agency said on Thursday.

title: Three arrested with 900kg of Kerala ganja and firearms in Wennappuwa
byline: Three individuals were taken into custody in the Bolawatta area of Wennappuwa during a joint operation carried out by the Sri Lanka Coast Guard, Navy, and Police Narcotic Bureau.

title: Shooting incident reported in Kandana
byline: A shooting incident has been reported in Kandana this morning (03).

title: Bangladesh ex-PM Hasina gets six-month prison sentence in absentia
byline: Bangladesh’s ousted and self-exiled Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina was sentenced to six months in prison by the country’s International Crimes Tribunal on Wednesday in a contempt of court case, a top prosecutor said.

title: Rise in child accidents a growing concern, expert warns
byline: A pediatrician at the Colombo South Teaching Hospital in Kalubowila, Professor Ruwanthi Perera has raised concerns over the increasing number of accidents involving children.

title: Sri Lanka to deploy seasonal workers to South Korea under E-8 Visa category
byline: Cabinet approval has been granted to implement a pilot program to facilitate the engagement of Sri Lankan labourers under the E-8 visa category (seasonal employees) in the Republic of Korea.

title: Trump says he will put 20% tariff on Vietnam’s exports
byline: The United States will place a lower-than-promised 20% tariff on many Vietnamese exports, Donald Trump said on Wednesday, cooling tensions with its tenth-biggest trading partner days before the U.S. president could raise levies on most imports.

title: Deepika Padukone makes history as first Indian actress on Hollywood Walk of Fame
byline: Deepika Padukone is set to create history as she becomes the first Indian actress to be honoured with a star on the prestigious Hollywood Walk of Fame.

title: More details revealed on Kandana shooting
byline: More details have been revealed regarding the shooting incident that occurred  near the Kandana Public Market at around 10.00 a.m. this morning (03).

title: Two injured in shooting incident at Kandana
byline: A shooting incident has been reported in Kandana this morning (03).

title: Kandana shooting: One victim succumbs to injuries
byline: One of the two persons who were injured in the Kandana shooting incident this morning has reportedly succumbed to injuries at hospital.

title: AliExpress halts low-cost shipping to Sri Lanka amid tax reforms
byline: AliExpress has officially suspended several of its budget shipping options to Sri Lanka and Pakistan following the implementation of revised customs tax regulations by the respective authorities.

title: Colombo HC dismisses preliminary objection in ‘Harak Kata’ case
byline: The Colombo High Court has dismissed a preliminary objection raised by the defense in the case filed against three accused individuals, including the notorious underworld figure Nadun Chinthaka Wickremeratne, alias Harak Kata.

title: Ex-Minister Mervyn Silva and 2 others granted bail
byline: Former Minister Mervyn Silva and two others were granted bail today (03) by the Gampaha High Court over allegations of selling state land in Kiribathgoda through forged documents.

title: Fire breaks out in a factory in Bingiriya
byline: A fire has broken out in a factory located in Bingiriya this afternoon (03), police stated.

title: French air traffic control strike disrupts global flights
byline: French air traffic controllers began a two-day strike today, disrupting hundreds of flights and causing delays that have rippled far beyond France’s borders.

title: Youth files FR petition alleging unlawful detention after incident with ‘Teacher Amma’
byline: A youth has filed a Fundamental Rights (FR) petition before the Supreme Court, alleging unlawful arrest and detention by the Katana Police following an incident involving Hyeshika Fernando, popularly known as ‘Teacher Amma’, a prominent Grade 5 scholarship tutor.

title: Sri Lanka-Hungary sign debt restructuring agreement amounting to Euro 30mn
byline: The government of Sri Lanka and the Hungarian Export Credit Insurance Plc. have signed a bilateral agreement in relation to the External Debt Restructuring Process, the Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development said in a statement.

title: 2026 Grade One Admissions: Instructions and model application issued
byline: List of instructions and the model application for the admission of children to grade one in government schools for the year 2026 have been issued by the Ministry of Education.

title: Govt appoints committee to tackle plastic pollution
byline: A committee has been appointed to investigate and submit a report on plastic-based products in the market that pose a threat to the health of children, the Ministry of Trade, Commerce, Food Security, and Cooperative Development has announced.

title: Plans underway to remove illegal constructions threatening Sigiriya – Archeology DG
byline: The Director General of the Department of Archaeology, Professor D. Thusitha Mendis, has announced plans to remove unauthorized constructions that are affecting Sri Lanka’s iconic Sigiriya Rock Fortress, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

title: Shooting incident reported in Negombo
byline: Another shooting incident has been reported at Dungalpitiya in Negombo, a short while ago.

title: Hundreds evacuated as Greece wildfire rages on Crete
byline: A wildfire fanned by gale-force winds on the southern Greek island of Crete has forced the evacuation of residents and tourists, officials said on Thursday (Jul 3).

title: Police fire tear gas due tense situation in Kahawatta
byline: Police fired tear gas to disperse a crowd due a tense situation in Kahawatta, following the funeral of the youth who was shot dead in Kahawatta on 30 June, police said.

title: Sri Lanka’s economic outlook remains positive but global trade policy uncertainties pose significant risks: IMF
byline: Sri Lanka’s economic outlook remains positive, however, global trade policy uncertainties pose significant risks to the country’s macroeconomic and social stability, the International Monetary Fund (IMF) has stated.

title: Woman hacked to death in Kuruwita
byline: A young woman has been murdered with a sharp weapon in Dewipahala, Kuruwita, police stated.

title: Police uncover more details related to Kandana shooting
byline: Police have uncovered further details in relation to the shooting which took place at around 10 a.m. opposite the Kandana Police Station.

title: Customs records over Rs. 1 Trillion in revenue in first six months of 2025
byline: Sri Lanka Customs has earned revenue exceeding Rs. 1 trillion (Rs. 1,000 billion) during the first six months of 2025, according to Media Spokesperson and Additional Director General of Customs Seevali Arukgoda.

title: NASA warns of giant airplane-sized asteroid racing towards earth tomorrow
byline: NASA has confirmed that asteroid 2025 MV89, a 120-foot-wide space rock approximately the size of a small passenger aeroplane, will safely pass by Earth on July 4.

title: SLTB bus overturns in Wattegama, 15 injured
byline: At least 15 individuals have been injured when a Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) bus traveling from Kudugala to Kandy via Wattegama veered off the road and overturned near a house in Araliya Uyana today (03).

title: Derana leads Sri Lanka in digital broadcasting excellence with two APAC awards
byline: Sri Lanka’s premier news provider, Ada Derana, has been recognised for its excellence in digital broadcasting at the prestigious Asia-Pacific Broadcasting+ Awards 2025, held at the Crowne Plaza Changi Airport, Singapore.

title: Individual remanded over another illegal motor vehicle registration incident
byline: An individual who was arrested over an incident involving the illegal registration of a motor vehicle that had not been lawfully cleared through Sri Lanka Customs, has been remanded until 8 July, Ada Derana Reporter said.

title: Delhi HC rejects actress Jacqueline Fernandez’s plea to quash money laundering case
byline: The Delhi High Court on Thursday (03) turned down a plea filed by Bollywood actress Jacqueline Fernandez seeking to quash a money laundering case registered against her by the Enforcement Directorate (ED).

title: Two officers of Peradeniya Registrar of Pesticides Office arrested for soliciting a bribe
byline: A development officer and a driver attached to the Office of the Registrar of Pesticides have been arrested for soliciting and accepting a bribe of Rs. 10,000 to register a business.

title: Four dead, 14 injured in drive-by shooting outside Chicago nightclub
byline: At least four people were killed and 14 others injured in a drive-by shooting outside a Chicago nightclub, police said.

title: ‘Army Upul’ shot dead in Ragama
byline: A person has been shot and killed in front of a residence at Batuwatte in Ragama, a short while ago.
